Jumin

Past members

Choi Davi

Introduction

Bijou is a co-ed duo currently under ON 1 Entertainment. The group's name means "jewel" in French. They debuted in 1998 with the studio album "Bijou Is Ballad", their original lineup consisted of female member Choi Dabi and male member Jumin. The group currently consists of Jumin and Haeon.


In 2000, Choi Dabi left to pursue a solo career, and Yerim was added to the group in 2003. After a two-year hiatus, Bijou renamed themselves 2Letter, and two new members, Jung Gahee and Kim Jieun, took Yerim's place. Bijou changed back to their original name in 2009, Jieun's departure returning the group to a duo. The group took a lengthy hiatus until 2017, when they returned with the digital single "Summer Night", Jumin accompanied by a guest vocalist. Moon Yoonjin joined as a regular vocalist starting 2019. Yoonjin left in 2023 and Haeon was added to the group.
